column6: Practice of basic modern dance technique. Open to all university students.
Exploration of modern dance technique foundations and improvisation with emphasis on the movement and performing qualities of modern dance. Open to all university students.
Practice of basic jazz techniques. Open to all university students.
Continuation of jazz dance technique foundations with emphasis on more advanced dance combinations. Open to all university students.
Basic tap steps and combinations with varying sound intensities and rhythms. Open to all university students.
Continuation of tap dance technique foundations with emphasis on more advanced dance combinations.
Advanced tap dance techniques with emphasis on clarity, speed and performance skills. Repeatable for a total of 8 hours.
Introduction to the foundations of ballet placement, vocabulary and movement for the beginner. Open to all university students.
Continuation of ballet technique foundations with emphasis on more advanced dance combinations. Open to all university students.
Designed to acquaint students with basic elements of African dance. Open to all university students.
Continued development of African movement styles and rhythms. Open to all university students.
Practice of basic swing dance movements with emphasis on social partnering skills. Open to all students. Repeatable to 2 credit hours.

column2: FUNDAMENTALS OF BALLET AND MODERN DANCE
column6: Introduction to intensive exploration of ballet and modern dance technique for non-majors with special emphasis on alignment, body awareness and movement vocabulary.
Overview of modern dance as a performing art. Specifically focusing on preparation, basic knowledge and career choices.
Development of skill acquisition in basic technique, understanding and appreciation for the creative nature of dance through exposure to improvisational experiences.
Ballet techniques: pre-barre; beginning barre and beginning center work.

column5: DAN 17051 or 17052. Prerequisite: Dance major and special approval.
column6: The study and application of alignment and basic movement principles to dance techniques. Corequisite: DAN 17051 or 17052.

column4: Dance major and DAN 17051 and special approval.
column6: Continued exploration of basic modern dance technique and improvisation begun in DAN 17051. Continued study of dance innovators and their historical significance.

column4: Dance major and DAN 17052 and special approval.
column6: Continuation of ballet techniques studied in DAN 17052. Repeatable for a total of 8 hours.

column4: Dance or Early Childhood Education major.
column6: The theory and practice of children's dance in the pre-Department, elementary, middle Departments, private studio and recreation settings. Repeatable for a total of 6 hours.
Development of basic jazz dance skills. Students must be at 20000-level technique in modern or ballet.
Intermediate modern dance styles emphasizing complex movement phrases. Repeatable for a total of 12 hours.

column4: Dance major; DAN 17152 and special approval.
column6: Intermediate ballet technique. Repeatable for a total of 8 hours.
Movement exploration and improvisation ,including developing the body as an instrument of expression. Repeatable for a total of 12 hours.
Survey of the various types, styles and functions of dance with emphasis on understanding dance as an art form and an expression of culture.
Continued development of basic jazz dance skills.
Continuation of intermediate level dance styles with emphasis on complex movement phrases. Repeatable for a total of 12 hours.
Continuation of intermediate ballet technique. Repeatable for a total of 8 hours.

column2: DANCE COMPOSITION II: ELEMENTS OF STRUCTURE
column6: Basic principles of dance composition with attention to design, thematic material, structure, form and small groups.
Continuation of DAN 17053. Repeatable for a total of 16 hours.
Theory and practice of teaching dance technique from middle school to adults with an emphasis on modern dance. Repeatable for a total of 6 hours.
Advanced ballet technique. Repeatable for a total of 8 hours.
Advanced modern dance technique. Repeatable for a total of 15 hours.

Development of individual movement style through improvisational studies and movement manipulation exercises of structure and form resulting in a substantial solo modern dance work. Repeatable for a total of 8 hours.
Analyzing and recording human movement. The common aspects of movement in all forms of sports, dance and aquatics. Analysis and recording with the labanotation system.
Continuation of advanced ballet technique.
Continuation of advanced modern dance technique.
Exploration of advanced composition skills in preparation for the B.F.A. senior choreography project and future choreographic endeavors.
(Repeatable for a total of 4 hours) practical experience in co-curriculum dance activities under faculty supervision.
Participation in rehearsal, preparation and performance of public dance concerts in an established dance ensemble.
Advanced technique integrating previously learned modern dance techniques and developing advanced movement phrasing.
A continuation of DAN 37167 with increasing clarity and control of movements.
development of pragmatic skills for entrance into professional dance careers. Emphasis on resume writing, preparation for auditions and economic survival.
History of dance from antiquity to 1900.
Jazz style for students with advanced dance technique.
Offered for specific professional needs. Emphasis on performance workshops. S u/graded.
(repeatable for a total of 24 hours) offered when resources permit a topic different from existing courses. Topic to be announced when scheduled.
Continuation of advanced technique integrating previously learned modern dance techniques and developing advanced movement phrasing with special emphasis on performing quality and movement range.
A continuation of DAN 47055 with increasing clarity and dynamic expression.
Study of elements involved in planning and implementing a concert. Experiential work in technical and management components.
History of the development of concert and theatrical dance forms from 1900 to present day.
Continuation of DAN 47070.
Creation of a modern dance work to be performed with full production values in an approved setting.
Supervised dance apprenticeship in an approved educational setting.
Selected topics of interest relating to dance.
Individual projects for dance majors.
